conversation.thought:
I am Parent_E, the lowest priority parent for all nurseries. My goal is to secure the highest possible match. My top choice is Nursery_E.

I analyze the expected behavior of other parents applying to their top choices:
- P_A -> N_B
- P_B -> N_A
- P_C -> N_C
- P_D -> N_D

If all higher priority parents (A, B, C, D) apply to their respective P1s, they will apply to N_B, N_A, N_C, and N_D respectively. Since these applications are distinct, they are likely to be accepted immediately by those nurseries (as they are the highest priority applicants received by those nurseries in this round, assuming no one deviates).

This means Nursery_E will likely receive only my application (Parent_E). Since Nursery_E has capacity 1, and I am the only applicant, they must accept me, even though I am the lowest priority parent overall.

Therefore, applying to my P1, Nursery_E, is the optimal strategy in Round 1 to maximize my utility.
